frame.name: Omen
frame.definition:
<def-root>One phenomenon, the <fen>Predictive_phenomenon</fen> is an indication of the future or current (but still uncertain) existence of another phenomenon, the <fen>Future_phenomenon</fen>. There is no Cognizer present on the scene, in distinction to the Expectation frame where a Cognizer takes (the equivalent of) <fen>Predictive_phenomenon</fen> as evidence for (the equivalent of) <fen>Future_phenomenon</fen>. Many words in this frame also allow a slightly different understanding, whereby <fen>Predictive_phenomenon</fen> provides clues as to the good or bad <fen>Outcome</fen> of an expected <fen>Future_phenomenon</fen>. Instead of <fen>Future_phenomenon</fen> an <fen>Interested_party</fen> that will be involved in the <fen>Future_phenomenon</fen> may be mentioned. In both construals, the two phenomena are asymmetrical and consequently they have no joint syntactic realization.
<ex> <fex name="Predictive_phenomenon">Such potential</fex> <t>augurs</t> <fex name="Outcome">well</fex> <fex name="Future_phenomenon">for the 1990s</fex> </ex> <ex><fex name="Predictive_phenomenon">Its appearance</fex> <m>was</m> an <fex name="Outcome">ill</fex> <t>omen</t>. </ex> <ex><fex name="Predictive_phenomenon">Cold-blooded words</fex> do not necessarily <t>betoken</t> <fex name="Future_phenomenon">a callous nature</fex>.</ex> <ex>I wish I could say <fex name="Predictive_phenomenon">my success</fex> <t>bodes</t> <fex name="Outcome">well</fex> <fex name="Interested_party">for him</fex>.</ex>
</def-root>

FE.name: Predictive_phenomenon
FE.definition:
<def-root><fen>Predictive_phenomenon</fen> provides evidence for the existence or the nature of the <fen>Outcome</fen> of <fen>Future_phenomenon</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Predictive_phenomenon">To achieve so much this year</fex> <t>augurs</t> well for the future.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Future_phenomenon
FE.definition:
<def-root><fen>Future_phenomenon</fen> is that phenomenon that is predicted to occur or have a particular quality.
<ex>This move <t>presages</t> <fex name="Future_phenomenon">a freeze on the granting of new concessions</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Outcome
FE.definition:
<def-root>The FE <fen>Outcome</fen> identifies those expressions that indicate how the <fen>Future_phenomenon</fen> is expected to turn out based on the evidence of the <fen>Predictive_phenomenon</fen>.
<ex>It all <t>bodes</t> <fex name="Outcome">well</fex> for the future.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Interested_party
FE.definition:
<def-root><fen>Interested_party</fen> marks expressions that indicate people who are interested in the <fen>Outcome</fen> of the <fen>Future_phenomenon</fen>.
<ex>That Meisel speaks so highly of Kate <t>bodes</t> well <fex name="Interested_party">for her</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Strength
FE.definition: <def-root>The degree to which the <fen>Predictive_phenomenon</fen> predicts the occurrence of the <fen>Future_phenomenon</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Time</fen> at which the omen is occuring. </def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition: <def-root>The reason for which the <fen>Predictive_phenomenon</fen> is an omen for the <fen>Future_phenomenon</fen> or the <fen>Outcome</fen>. </def-root>

FE.name: Circumstances
FE.definition: <def-root>Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants. </def-root>

FE.name: Duration
FE.definition: <def-root>The length of time that the <fen>Predictive_phenomenon</fen> indicates a particular <fen>Future_phenomenon</fen> or <fen>Outcome</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition:
<def-root>The location where something good or bad might occur.
<ex>The storm <t>bodes</t> ill for you <fex name="Place">here</fex> .</ex></def-root>
